direction.raw_text: The suggestion of traveling through space. Suddenly a star sparkles to life in the distance. Gives rise to another... and another... until we're looking at a whole galaxy of stars. No, not stars. LIGHTS. NEON LIGHTS. A throbbing skyline of neon. LAS VEGAS, NEVADA. As seen from a descending aerial shot. We PLUNGE down into her shimmering embrace... DISSOLVING TO:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BINION'S HORSESHOE, THE FOUR QUEENS, THE LAS VEGAS CLUB

direction.raw_text: Cruising the Strip, taking in modern day Las Vegas. Sin City gone theme park. Gigantic behemoths of pulsating neon: THE MGM GRAND... EXCALIBUR... LUXOR... TREASURE ISLAND... passing revamped faithfuls like CAESARS and THE DESERT INN... ...then heading DOWNTOWN to Fremont Street, where "old school" Vegas makes its last stand. BINION'S HORSESHOE, THE FOUR QUEENS, THE LAS VEGAS CLUB arid...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing's for sure. This place ain't no bastard child of Epcott Center. At least, not yet. Sure there's some flash going on, but it's more class than overkill. This is where the pro's come to savor a time forgotten. A joint where every dealer knows your name. Where part of the allure is the smell of moldy paneling and the tactile whisper of worn felt. Where "funny business" doesn't just get you blacklisted... It gets you dead. Lets us enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the casino floor; highlighting SLOT MACHINE PAY-OFFS and pockets of rowdy players winning at BLACKJACK, CRAPS and ROULETTE. It's just one of those nights. The tables are on fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods as a hefty bet is paid out to a shooter at a craps table: He checks out his watch, anxious for the arrival of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From behind a FIGURE in a suit. All we see is a murky reflection in gold elevator doors. The floor numbers descending rapidly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all anticipating the arrival of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors open... and we PAN DOWN to the figure's feet. He steps out onto the casino floor... and right away we notice he has a pronounced limp. Following behind the figure. We haven't seen his features yet... (and won't for a while.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the figure (seen in soft focus) passes a ROULETTE TABLE, the wheel already in mid-spin. His hand casually brushes the side of the table... and we PAN ACROSS to the wheel -- just in time to see the ball landing on 00. The players HOWL defeat. The croupier rakes in all the losing checks with a slight nod of respect to the passing wraith...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PAST SOME BLACKJACK TABLES... RACKING from the passing figure (still in soft focus) to a DEALER calling out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the next table, ANOTHER DEALER pulls a six card 21. Off the players' stunned reactions. No way! One of the players instinctively glances behind him... but the figure has moved on. The dealer stifles a grin, her eyes following the figure as he heads toward...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Insurance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . The CROWD APPLAUDS as the shooter lands a hard eight. The dice are fished back to the player. He shakes them up with double ought bravado. We RACK from his hand LARGE in the f.g. to our murky figure passing in the background. The player throws... (we keep tracking with the figure) as the stickman calls it: SEVEN OUT! to a thundering chorus of disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our figure passes by in the foreground, while in the background, we see a growing line of shame at one of the ATM MACHINES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Following behind our figure as he turns into a corridor of SLOT MACHINES. CUT TO REVERSE ANGLE from the far end of the corridor. As the murky figure approaches, a player in the f.g. hits a jackpot. Another player in mid-ground is also in the midst of a payout. Suddenly -- with the approach of the figure -- both payouts trickle to a stop.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .G. (kicks the slot machine) Don't you hold back, baby. Spit it out, darlin'. C'mon... Hey! Hey, this ain't right. S'posed to be eight hundred dollars. Where's the goddamn manager? Who's in charge of these rip-off slots? Yo, ma'am... change lady...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BAR AREA - NIGHT FOLLOWING BEHIND the figure as he turns out of the slot corridor and heads over to the bar. He pours himself a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Doris, you got any cream?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: wanders over with a small container. She starts to pour... Empty. We quickly STEADICAM AROUND to reveal BERNIE LOOTZ's features for the first time. His sad sack eyes register scant surprise at the empty cream container.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's just about to leave, when an attractive COCKTAIL WAITRESS cruises up. NATALIE BELISARIO -- late 20's-mid-30's. Everything about her sparkles, except her eyes. They're post-mortem. She appears frazzled. Sifts through some coin tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sheepish look comes over Bernie. He tries to catch her eye. She doesn't even glance at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him. Only the faintest hint of recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doris mutters something under her breath -- heard that one before -- and dumps Natalie's drinks on her tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie grabs up her tray. Doesn't even look at Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She raises the empty cream container for effect, turns it over. A few drops dribble out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Shit. (to Doris) Dewars and a Diet Coke. Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. Uh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, Bernie. (to Doris) Hey, you seen Shelly around? He promised to position me at the tables tonight. I've been on skid row all week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chilly) You didn't settle me from last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No? You sure? Fuck... And I was way under. It's been, like, an A.A. convention the whole week. I'll make up for it tonight. Promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I see Shelly, I'll let him know. That you're looking for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bitch. That's the third time this month... (to Bernie) Let me get you that cream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring after Natalie) Nah, it's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get sweet on that, Bernie. Not unless you're looking to get short- changed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie limps away from the bar. We hear another spike of sound from the gaming area. As he approaches, a FLOORMAN stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floorman nods, walks off. Bernie makes for the rowdy gaming tables. Takes his time about it. His approach brings an ill-wind to the area. The players appear to sense it. It's in their reactions. A slight hesitation of the dice. Fingers tensing over a pile of chips. A hand tugging at a tie. The Cooler has arrived. As he reaches table eleven, Natalie intercepts him with a short glass of Chivas Regal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie just smiles at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She offers up a smile. It jump-starts those dormant eyes. Her whole face comes alive. Notches her up from an eight to a ten. Bernie immediately glances away. He's afraid what she might read in his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie gestures her over to table eleven. Immediately makes the HIGH ROLLER in question. A good old boy named BULLDOG. He's the one boasting loudly as he shakes the dice with one hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie grabs the drink from Natalie's tray, intentionally bumps Bulldog...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another man gladly accepts the drink. Meanwhile, Bulldog sends the dice high up into the air. They drop perfectly on the table. The stickman calls it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The croupiers hungrily devour the chips from the table. Bernie moves on quietly before anyone notices. But he's been noticed all right. By Natalie. Not quite sure what she's just witnessed. Who is this guy? We hear a VOICE over the intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie reacts immediately to the code words over the speaker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Bernie, Shelly needs you on eleven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Uh... Let's do the Chivas Regal. Have that... Natalie bring it over. The one working nickel slots next to the Paradise. I spoke to Shelly earlier, he wants her at the tables.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is you, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes it from her) Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe said I should stick around. You say something to Shelly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow. That was fast. Hey, thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mention it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make you a fortune on five and nine. C'mon forty-five-sixty-three fifty-four!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, buddy, is this your drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back off, pal. I'm on a roll here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother-fucker!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for those bets, folks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Conway, party of twelve, please check your reservation at the Paradise Lounge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) Yeah, yeah, I'm comin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a player makes a hard six at a craps table. The players howl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the same angle we PAN UP from losing dice to the same guy. Bernie looming large in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie taking a seat at another blackjack table. Next to him, a full table of players on a good run of cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same table with less players as the dealer appears to be gaining an edge over the players. The only thing filling up are ashtrays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same again, with one player. This time with Natalie watching in the background. Intrigued. QUICK JUMP CUTS show the player's mountain of chips going down until there is only one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dealer taps the felt for the man to bet his last chip. After a moment of indecision he flips the chip into the air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the chip becoming an Alka-Seltzer dropping into a glass. The glass is in SHELLY KAPLOW's hand. Director of Casino Operations for the Shangri-la. Late 40's-early 50's. Distinguished, slick, oozing charm. But lose the Cartier, Armani and Paco Raban and you're looking at pure street. He's watching Bernie through the two-way glass. Shakes his head in admiration. Suddenly the office door swings open. THREE MEN stride in. Shelly projects immediate deference to NICKY "FINGERS" BONNATTO. Mid-50's. Former Geovassi family underboss from "back east." The guy's a relic from the days before MBAs became the weapon of choice in the "family" business. He wears his corporate makeover like a bad coat of paint with traces of Mulberry Street primer showing through. Nicky's accompanied by a pair of CORPORATE TYPES in Hugo Boss threads. Shelly glances their way with a look that suggests he's working himself into a full-on sphincter wind- up. Bad news x2. Shelly's muscle, LOU stands off to one side with an apologetic expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky reaches out to shake Shelly's hand. Gets nothing back, then remembers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky grabs Shelly, embraces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly sizes up the corporate types.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly sees where this is going. Larry extends his hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...then catches himself. Quickly pulls it back. Shelly stares him down for a tense beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off their uncomfortable expressions...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nicky, how the hell are you? I didn't know you were coming in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) Whassimater? You think I don't wash up after goin' to the John? Forget about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncomfortably) You shoulda called ahead. I woulda sent a car...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ehh. We thought we'd surprise you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, anytime, Nicky. Anytime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, I want you to meet one of our smartest VPs, Larry Sokolov. And his numbers guy, Marty Goldfarb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you do, Shelly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What can I get you boys to drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A SHORT WHILE LATER - NIGHT Shelly seated across from Nicky, Larry and Marty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky looks cautiously across the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky shoots a look over at Larry and Marty. Larry takes this as his cue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly nods carefully. But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky and Larry exchange looks. Marty drops his gaze into his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly is close to losing it. He catches himself, takes a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry shoots him a disapproving look. Off Shelly's disturbed expression. He's already calculating serious damage control.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So... what brings you to town, Nicky?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Shelly, this is your joint, you run it the way you see fit. But we got a smart kid here and he's got some good ideas on how to revitalize the Shangri-la.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Revitalize? What are you talking about? We did thirty-five million last year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: First off, Shelly, I want you to know, I have nothing but respect for you. You've done a fantastic job with the Shangri-la for the last sixteen years. No one would dispute that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, no one doubts that, Shelly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, the business has changed out here. You just have to take a look at the Strip to see what I'm talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean, that amusement park mook fest out there? You know what that is? That's a fucking violation of something that used to be beautiful. That used to have class. Like a gorgeous high priced hooker with an exclusive clientele. And then that Steve Wynn cocksucker knocks her up and puts her in a family way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now she's nothing but a cheap, fat whore hiding behind too much makeup. I look at her and see all those ugly stretch marks and I want to cry. 'Cause I remember her as she was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, well... there's no denying the bottom line. Those eyesores are raking it in. And we can't compete against that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? You think I'm trying to compete with that? You think this joint's about bringing in the stroller crowd? Fresh off some fucking E-ticket ride, looking to break the house on red and black. Fremont's never been about that bullshit. This is where old time and real money comes to play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The numbers, they don't back you up, Shelly. Nostalgia's grand. We all love nostalgia -- but it belongs in a museum. I think it's time to decide whether you're running a museum or a casino.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, forget about it. We'll talk later. Over dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rubs his hands together) So, how's the action?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie makes his way across the casino floor, when he's intercepted by Shelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly escorts Bernie over to a nearby bar area. The BARTENDER zips over with some drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie shrugs. Natalie steps up to the bar a few feet away. Puts in a drink order. She catches Bernie's eye. Nods. Bernie smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beautiful WOMAN in a low cut dress, sashays her way past them, heading for a high rollers craps table. Shelly reaches out, napkin in hand, grabs her arm. Hands her his card. She snatches it, looks it over. Immediately loses all attitude. Oh shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hooker just nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes off. At the same time Natalie leaves with her drink order. They walk in the same direction. Shelly mistakes Bernie's wandering look for interest in the hooker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie just stares after Natalie, Shelly finally picking up on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He limps off. Shelly stares after him. A predator seizing up his prey. Calculating.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie. Mr. Cool. Got a moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just heading over to -- SHELLY It can wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's the knee?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was speaking to this orthopedic surgeon over at Vegas Memorial. He tells me they can replace a man's entire kneecap with titanium. It's the kinda thing that costs a shitload, but since the man's into us for five hundred large, I'm sure we could -- BERNIE (stealing glances at Natalie) I told you, I'm not gonna be around after Sunday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) Where you gonna go, Bernie? Where the fuck are you gonna go that's better'n here? I got you covered in this town. People, they know you work for me, that's currency in your pocket. That's fuckin' respect when you walk the floor. Where you gonna get that anyplace else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) Seven days, Shelly. Seven days and I'm out from under.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. I like to know who's shopping it in my neighborhood. You wanna keep working the Shangri-la, you come see me tomorrow morning in my office. We'll go over the rules together. And before you come, you bring me a clean bill of health. OK?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, get outta here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want that, Bernie? She's yours. Anytime. I'll keep a tab running for you. (Bernie shakes his head) What's a matter? Not your type?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Things are getting hot on fourteen. I gotta go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie's 1958 Buick Electra pulls into the parking lot of a flea-bag motel. Next door to the motel, we see a convenience store with the name, THE EZ MARK in pink glowing neon. It's actually supposed to read: The EZ MARKET, but the last two letters of "Market" have burned out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of those center pool style motels. A hard luck oasis, if ever there was one. As Bernie limps toward his room, his neighbor, a low rent HOOKER, approaches from the opposite end of the courtyard with a huge-ass JOHN in tow. They converge at their doors at the same time. There's a weariness about the hooker that's endemic to this town. She winks at Bernie. He nods at her. Then casts a furtive glance over at the John. The man flips him off. The hooker mouths, "Sorry." Bernie hastily enters his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie flips on the light. A dim overhead bulb hardly makes a dent in the gloomy surroundings. Typical drab motel furnishings. We notice a couple of dead plants on the radiator next to the window. A single place setting on the counter. Something odd: an empty cat food bowl on the kitchenette floor. No sign of a cat. Go figure. Bernie heads over to the dresser. A half-filled bottle of gin rests next to a lone glass with a crack down the side. He pours himself a shot. Turns on the TV. A religious channel. Shitty reception.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : an Appalachian Pentecostal service. The members of the congregation taking up snakes and writhing around in religious hysteria, while a number at the bottom of the screen solicits viewer donations. Bernie doesn't even try to change the channel. He takes a seat on his bed, props himself up against a pair of pillows, stretches out. From next door, the sounds of wild humping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie closes his eyes, tries to ignore the X-rated soundtrack coming at him through the carpaccio thin walls. The hooker's moans are starting to get to him. He raises his fist to the wall, then stops himself. He's just not the confrontational type. Instead, he heads over to the TV, cranks the volume up. The hysterical moaning from the snake ritual now blends in with the grunting and groaning from next door, making for a bizarre remix that could only exist in the world of Bernie Lootz. Bernie emits a deep sigh, closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ...Oh yeah, baby, give it to me. Oh yeah, that's the spot... Do it to me harder, you big stud... Oooooh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Big action at the craps tables tonight. The players cheer as MR. PINKERTON makes another pass. He exudes USED CAR SALESMAN. Natalie arrives with his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinkerton reaches for the drink without taking his eyes off the table. He throws a hard six. The crowd cheers again. He turns around, stuffs a hundred dollar chip down her shirt and slyly cops a feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie shudders in disgust. She spins around to leave... runs smack into Bernie, spilling her tray of drinks on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie wipes himself off, helps her pick up the pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie tries to wipe him down a bit more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie wiggles his way next to Pinkerton. He gives the stickman a certain look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie just watches as Pinkerton throws the dice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The players go nuts. The stickman taps the felt in front of the shooter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Boxman seated at the center looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Boxman feigns concern, then nods in approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as the stickman feeds Pinkerton the dice, Bernie flips a dollar chip over toward the center of the table. Natalie peers between them to catch a glimpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chip lands on Pinkerton's parlayed bet. He releases the dice from his stubby little fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The players cry out in defeat. Pinkerton grumbles to himself. He fingers his rail of chips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws in the chips. The croupier places his bets. The dice are fed back to him. He throws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinkerton is fit to be tied. After a passing moment of clarity he empties his entire rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire table stops down for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinkerton sets his dice carefully and lets them fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinkerton slams his fist down on the table. He turns to leave the table to find Natalie smiling at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinkerton starts to lose it. Security moves in, right on time. Natalie shoots Bernie a satisfied look. He averts his eyes shyly and limps away. She stares after him for a moment.

direction.raw_text: the Paradise Lounge's star attraction, is performing on stage. He's a poor man's Tony Bennett. Mid to late 60's. A staple at the Paradise for the last 20 years. The singer sluggishly descends the stage to the lounge floor, almost tripping over his microphone cable. Buddy works the room, leaning in real close to the ladies, delivering the requisite eye contact. When their companions react with mock outrage, Buddy raises his fists playfully in a boxer's defensive stance. It's classic Buddy Stafford schtick. From somewhere across the lounge, an ATTRACTIVE WOMAN jumps up and throws her panties at Buddy. Buddy catches them and waves them in the air... just as another pair whizzes by... We PAN ACROSS to Shelly seated at his corner booth, in the company of Nicky Fingers, Larry and Marty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he focuses on Buddy. A smile threatens his patented stoicism. He's flashing back on the old days. While Nicky and Marty are clearly enjoying Buddy's performance, Larry fixates on the singer with joyless eyes. We take on LARRY'S POV of Buddy -- SLOW MOTION CLOSE-UPS of BUDDY SINGING. The MUSIC SLOWED DOWN with the action, emphasizing Buddy's lack of energy. Sweat dripping off Buddy's forehead, splattering into tiny jewels against his microphone. Buddy's tired eyes. Shaking hands around the mic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to real time APPLAUSE as Buddy reaches the end of the song. Larry is the only one not clapping. RACK ACROSS to Shelly as he picks up on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly approaches Buddy's dressing room. He enters without knocking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...to find a trembling Buddy hunched over on a sofa, hugging himself. Buddy immediately sits up...

He glances over at Larry, who takes in Buddy's deathly repose without a hint of emotion. Larry meets Shelly's eye with a subtle smirk of one-upmanship. An incendiary beat passes between them. Then...

direction.raw_text: NING off the sign and following a COUPLE through the doors into the theater. ...our eye drawn to the stage. A troupe of gorgeous FEMALE DANCERS in leopard print G-strings, grinding their hips to the muscular rhythm. Flanking them are a pair of strutting LIONS in elevated cages. An EXPLOSION OF LIGHT and SMOKE... and JOHNNY CAPPELLA makes his entrance. Decked out in a reflective suit that picks up every light in the house and throws it back at the audience. Johnny's got the style of a Harry Connick Jr. and the moves of Ricki Martin. The energy this guy brings to the stage makes the last twenty years of Buddy Stafford's reign seem like suspended animation. The women in the audience start fanning themselves with delight. It's a new dawn in Paradise. And the panties are coming fast and furious. We see Shelly watching from the back of the room. He shifts his attention to Nicky, Larry and Marty at a primo table. They're having a grand time. Nicky pats Larry on the back of the head. "Good work, kid." Larry turns and raises his drink to Shelly. Shelly stares right through him. A declaration of war.

Natalie fixates on the boy with a haunted expression. Bernie picks up on it.

direction.raw_text: Natalie hides her face behind her soda cup. Looks off in the distance.

direction.raw_text: She tears her eyes away from Bernie. Bernie can't believe what he's hearing. That she wants to be invested in him. What could be so bad?

direction.raw_text: She lowers her soda. Turns to Bernie. He studies her for a lengthy beat, stoic features. She wipes away her tears. Oh well, that's that. Bernie stands up. Looks around... focuses on the arcade clock. It reads 1:40 a.m. He turns to her...

direction.raw_text: Off Natalie's tear-filled features. She breaks into a laugh- cry...

dialogue.raw_text: Over here, young lady! C'mon, give it a try. Eight for a dollar.

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Easy mark. You never heard that term?

dialogue.raw_text: When we were kids, Shelly and me, we used to work Coney Island during the summer. When a guy would walk up and seemed eager to open his wallet, we would always mark him with chalk. We'd pat him on the back or arm with the chalk. Like, 'Hey buddy, good job!' (pats Natalie) Meanwhile, he had no clue the other guys saw him coming a mile away. Easy mark.

dialogue.raw_text: (are you kidding?!) Little Joe.

dialogue.raw_text: I had a son. His name was Joe. I was his mother for a year.

dialogue.raw_text: You know, you don't have to tell me this.

dialogue.raw_text: I gave my son up for adoption. I just wanted my life back. I was seventeen going on eighteen and I was selfish. My family, they didn't want to have nothing to do with me after that. So I hitched a ride out here. Figured I could make it as a showgirl. Ten years later... (shrugs; starts to break up) I like to think that if it happened when I was older -- with some guy I cared about -- maybe things would have been different. I think about my Little Joe. And, I do know he's better off. I'm convinced of that.

The model boasts huge snow-capped Himalayan peaks a la "Lost Horizon," surrounding a completely overhauled hotel and casino. A Matterhorn-like rollercoaster traverses the mountain top. Gold and marbled pillars, terraces and floors promise to raise the bar on Las Vegas opulence. We're looking at a hundred million dollar investment easy.

direction.raw_text: Off Shelly's startled expression -- NICKY I know what you're thinking? Where's she gonna go? You need space to expand, right? Well, that's been taken care of. We're now the proud owners of The Golden Frontier next door.

dialogue.raw_text: In "Lost Horizon," these people, their plane crashes in the Himalayas -- and they get rescued and taken to this Utopia in the mountains. Shangri- la. It's beautiful. The place is completely isolated. Untouched by the outside world. There's no war, no greed, no bullshit... Time is slowed down. People, they don't age. It's... paradise. That's what Shangri- la is. When the people, they come looking for the real Vegas, from before all this Epcott Center bullshit. Who's gonna it give it to them? You guys? I don't think so. You know who? The same fucks who started this shit in the first place. It's all gonna come full circle and bite you in the ass. Mark my words.

dialogue.raw_text: You make some good points, Shelly. Maybe it'll swing back the other way, who knows? But the smart money suggests we roll the dice. I'm not gonna bullshit you; naturally there's gonna be a lot of restructuring in the months to come, but I want you to know, you'll always have a place with us.

direction.raw_text: The stickman thanks him as they place the bet. Mikey throws down more money. We can see Mikey has bets all over the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As everyone dotes over Charlene, Mikey quickly swaps the dice before anyone can see. He throws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey is paid nine thousand by the croupier, as is Charlene. Bernie stands frozen. He doesn't bother trying to get any closer to the table. He knows it'll do no good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie looks over at Charlene. Their eyes meet for a second. It's as though Natalie knows it's a scam and Charlene's acknowledging it. Mikey throws again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another nine grand. Mikey's rail is nearly full. Charlene hops around awkwardly causing more distraction. Bernie is really sweating it out now. Then Shelly arrives. Larry is hot on his tail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly's expression tells us he isn't so sure. Something definitely isn't kosher. As Charlene chatters on, Mikey switches the dice back. Shelly makes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey throws...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The players and crowd, though disappointed, applaud Mikey's achievement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey moves his rail of chips to the felt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry notices Shelly slipping on a pair of leather gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly walks over to Mikey and Charlene, Larry lingering behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey steals a tense glance at Charlene. She starts to fidget nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Security (Tony and Lou) corrals the couple. Leads them away. Bernie watches as they pass by. Mikey looks into Bernie's eyes. They both know he's been made. Natalie doesn't say anything, just looks at Bernie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (clutching her tummy) Come on, Mikey. This is our future. Don't blow it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put this on the line for the boys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With shoes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dealer's got shoes. Hands high, the dice are out! The point is nine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on all you's. Put a good thought in for our baby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six the hard way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my god, I just felt him kick! He knows. He knows you're all pulling for him. God bless you all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six the hard way! Look out, we got a shooter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eighteen thousand since I stepped up. I'm sorry, Shelly, I guess I've been hit and miss lately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Fucking amateurs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven out! Line away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bowing) I thank you. My wife thanks you. My unborn child thanks you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Color me up will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've gotta be kidding me. (off Shelly's steely glare) That's not how I propose we handle it. We'll turn the matter over to the authorities. They'll be blacklisted, their credit ruined...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gets in Larry's face) And then we'll give 'em both a lollipop for the ride home. Come watch and learn, Harvard. A little lesson on how to protect your investment -- the old school way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that was some run you had back there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, thanks. Just lucky I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't we go do this in my office? I don't like to hand out all this amount of cash on the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Slot machines everywhere -- some on the way out, some on the way in. Crates of casino supplies. Bernie rushes in with Natalie behind him. Heading for an aural beacon of BLOWS landing on flesh... GRUNTING, PLEADING... ...arriving to find Tony and Lou kicking the shit out of Mikey on the floor. Charlene lies clutching her belly a few feet away. Shelly swings a baseball bat, warming up for some blood sport. Larry watches from the sidelines -- at once appalled and enthralled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie rushes over to Shelly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone stops dead. Freeze frame. Shelly gets a weird look in his eye. A fuse has just been lit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly smashes Mikey across the shoulder with the bat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God... I can feel the contractions coming on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, stop them! Don't do this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get lost, Bernie, this got nothing to do with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's got everything to do with me. He's my son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said, he's my -- SHELLY Who? This little prick?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !!! Shelly raises the bat to cream Mikey again... Bernie grabs Shelly's arm. Shelly shoves him back. Raises the bat again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly freezes. He lowers the bat, throws it aside. Grabs Bernie by his collar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly releases Bernie. There's a strange look in Shelly's eye. We see the wheels turning...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie sees where Shelly's going with this. We can almost hear the cell door slamming in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie glances over at Natalie. She has tears in her eyes. He looks to Shelly pleadingly. Please don't do this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly glances over at Lou, nods. Lou kicks Mikey in the face. His nose snaps like a twig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlene clutches her belly, moans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Shelly kicks Charlene in the belly! WHAM! She screeches out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even Shelly's goons can't believe what they've just witnessed. Larry is aghast. Bernie rushes Shelly, starts raining blows on him. Shelly swats him off. He drops down next to the squirming girl, rips her sweater and blouse up over her stomach... ...to reveal a mound of fake padding. He tears the padding away from her, throws it at Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The muscle start laughing it up. Relief. Larry emits a nervous giggle. Natalie's jaw hits the floor. Bernie takes a step back. He's about to go into serious shock. Charlene curls over, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie looks over at Mikey. He stares up at his father, trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie holds his son's gaze for a beat. He's almost tempted to... He just shrugs and nods at Shelly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pop, help me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, don't you fucking do it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you in on this? Jesus, you better come clean with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! God, no! I didn't know nothing about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much you think their lives are worth, Bernie? Myself, I don't think they're worth piss. But, hey, it ain't my kid...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me see: they were up almost a hundred and fifty grand. That's 150 G's someone's gonna have to account for. What do you say, Bernie, seventy- five grand a piece?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I know you don't have that kind of cash. But, since you're a friend of the house, I'm willing to front you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, they didn't get away with the money... You didn't lose anything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Jesus... Yes! All right. It's on me. 150 G's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god, oh god... you gotta get me to the hospital... contractions...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, please help her. That's my grandson...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, why don't we all break out the champagne? Lootz is about to become a granddaddy. (walks over to her) How you doin' there, sweetheart? Must hurt like crap, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Hurts so bad...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus NOOOOO!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here! It's a fuckin' boy. Anyone got a cigar?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bernie) You sure you still want to be good for it? Because if you want to change your mind, I don't blame you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make it up to you, Pop, I swear...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's on me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) That's the worst fucking call you ever made in your life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: at that moment. We can tell she agrees with Shelly... but thinks all the more of Bernie for it. That might even be love in her eyes. Shelly snatches his baseball bat up off the floor. Walks over to Mikey, and brings it down full force, pulverizing Mikey's left kneecap. Oh man, the scream...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie turns her head. She's about to throw up. Larry watches, unflinchingly. Charlene is making with some serious pleading now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly steps up to Charlene, tapping the base of the bat in the palm of his hand. He smiles reassuringly at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly turns his back on her. Charlene starts sobbing relief. They're not going to hurt her. It's going to be all right. Wrong. Shelly throws the bat to Lou. The heavy steps up to the plate (as we RACK FOCUS to Shelly walking away) -- CRUNCH!!! followed by the girl's SHRIEKS. Natalie buries her head in Bernie's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly catches Larry's eye: I hope you were taking notes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?! I thought we had -- SHELLY 150 G's buys their lives. This is just a little slap on the wrist to remember me by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh god... it wasn't my idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, motherhood is a beautiful thing. This... you made a mockery out of it. Maybe you'll get to experience it for real one day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods, sobbing) I want... to be a mother... please don't hurt me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going to hurt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Tony and Lou) Get 'em outta here. You ever see them in this joint again, kill 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bernie and Natalie) You two, you're still on shift.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie's seated on the edge of his bed, drowning his sorrows with a bottle of gin. Moonlight paints him in jail bars of shadow. Natalie lingers in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie's hand lowers the needle onto the Sinatra record. "Nice 'n' Easy" starts up. She walks over to Bernie, takes the bottle away. Helps him to his feet. He gives himself over to her reassuring embrace. Natalie raises Bernie's face to her's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie shakes his head. It's too late for that now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I did this to myself. I planted the seed. When Angela took off with Mikey, I didn't... I never made an effort to get back in his life. I figured, the kid don't need a loser for a father. Now it's all come full circle. I give him the money, I open the door to all this... I musta had it coming. Payback.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie, it's a big world out there. If you just took off -- if we took off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: LATER - NIGHT Natalie staring up at the ceiling, Bernie nuzzled against her. Her features appear softer than ever. Luminous in the moonlight. Realization moist in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grunts something inaudible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie tenses up. Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie raises his head, not quite sure he heard her right. Natalie sits up, hugs her knees. Bernie finds himself staring at her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie reaches out, caresses her back. She emits a shiver...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie pulls Natalie back toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie smothers her lips against Bernie's. He enshrouds her in his arms. Fade out...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You awake, Bernie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: think I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't think. I'm pretty certain of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You blind-sided me, Bernie Lootz. I never saw this coming. You shouldn't do that to a girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's still things you don't know... should know... I don't want to ruin it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It won't make any difference, Natalie. Whatever you come clean about, I'm not gonna feel any different about you. I'd say the words, but with my luck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say 'em anyway. To hell with rotten luck. That's overs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a beat) I love you, Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fade into SOFT FOCUS. Slowing taking form... A CAT'S FACE seen in extreme close-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R -- to reveal the cat resting on Bernie's chest. She MEOWS as he stirs awake. He's stunned to see her there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cat jumps off his chest and slinks over to her empty food bowl. Meows again. Bernie breaks into a wide smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie shields his eyes from the bright sunlight streaming in through the blinds. Huh? This is a first for him. He's never gotten direct sunlight in his room before. What's the deal? Did the world just turn on its axis? He glances over his shoulder... No Natalie. Just her impression in the sheets. And a note on her pillow. For a moment his heart stops. He conjures up the worst. Grabs up the note, unfolds it. We see a lipstick kiss and the words: HAVE A SPECTACULAR DAY! Bernie lets out a joyful whoop! Leaps out of bed...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Trixie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trix. You came back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -UP: Trixie eating some tuna out of her bowl. We hear the record player needle drop on "Luck Be A Lady." Cut to: Bernie's feet gliding around the room... PAN UP to Bernie dancing with himself. He's positively aglow. He snatches up a salt shaker and sings along with Sinatra. It's true -- love makes the world go around. It obviously also gives life to dead plants, as evidenced by the small bulb that has sprung up overnight above his radiator. But we won't dwell on that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie struts into the casino a changed man (still to the tune of "Luck Be a Lady"). Even his limp seems less pronounced as he greets fellow workers as they pass. He catches a glimpse of himself in a wall mirror. Maybe for the first time, he likes what he sees. In the reflection he notices Natalie smiling at him. He meets her eyes. She averts them quickly, keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly watches Bernie from the video monitor. He appears less than delighted over Bernie's sunny disposition. He picks up the phone, dials.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Yeah, it's me. Get Bernie over to crap table six.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Per usual, Bernie walks up to the bar, asks for a cup of coffee. Doris slides it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before he can answer, Doris hands him a container of cream. A full container. Taken aback, he starts pouring it into his cup, when he hears a VOICE over the intercom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie looks to Doris.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (looking around) Got any cre --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Lovett, party of six, your table is ready, Lovett, party of six.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Duty calls.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie arrives at a hundred dollar blackjack table just in time for the dealer to bust out. The crowd goes crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie takes a break by leaning up against the side of a slot machine. Suddenly, the woman playing it hits a jackpot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everywhere he seems to go, people continue to win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie, despite the spooky irony, can't help but smile as mountains of chips pile up on the tables. Shelly appears behind him. Not a happy camper. He gestures Bernie to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They head over to a section of slots. As they pass one of those huge million dollar slots, the FLOOR MANAGER cuts in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands Shelly a cup of quarters, takes off. Shelly looks to Bernie. He's trying to keep a lid on his anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly pulls the lever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marnie immediately spits out a small jackpot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly starts feeding Marnie again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the mention of Natalie's name, we hear a shrieking SIREN, followed by a deafening toll of slot bells. Shelly's just landed the million dollar jackpot. Shelly stares at the slot in surprise -- then looks over at Bernie. Realization hits hard. Fuck! The floor manager staggers over. His expression is priceless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Shelly, check it out. The new Mega-Million. I call her Marnie, 'cause she's one frigid broad. Sure, once in a while she'll flash you a bit of tit, but your chances of hitting a home run -- one in twenty million. Here, give her a shot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (feeding Marnie quarters) You wanna tell me what's going on out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts with surprise) What do you mean, you don't know? We're down almost a mil out there. Doesn't seem strange to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) Guess I'm having an off day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have off days, Lootz. You're shitty luck incarnate. What's wrong? You coming down with something? You've got this look about you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing's wrong. Fact is, I've never felt better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She loves me, Shelly. She told me last night. Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sweet Jesus... you popped her cherries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: have gathered to witness the deflowering of Marnie. They gaze reverently upon her, as if witnessing the "Close Encounters" mothership for the first time. Shelly drags Bernie out of earshot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie nods, a huge grin wrenching his cheeks apart. He's about to go helium on us.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Natalie? She told you, she loves you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Natalie's serving drinks to a table of high rollers, when Tony and Lou appear behind her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door to Shelly's office slams behind Natalie. Shelly glares at her from behind his desk. We see him thumbing his steel abacus. The beads drifting toward the center. Natalie shakily lights up a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie, startled, drops her cigarettes. She kneels to gather them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly walks around his desk to Natalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie rushes from the office in tears. Shelly closes his eyes for a moment -- gotta keep it together.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Put that fucking thing out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should be. You've gone and fucked it up big time. I paid you to be his cooze companion, not his fucking true love. But, no, you had to go and get all profound on the poor schmuck. (mimics female voice)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: love you, Bernie." You know what you've gone and done, sweetheart? Those four little words of endearment have already cost this casino a million and counting today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumps to his feet) Lady luck. You never heard'a lady luck?! That's what's goin' on out there. Lootz is Kryptonite on a stick. He should have 'em throwing ice cubes out there, but instead I got a fuckin' meltdown on my hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: here's what's gonna happen. You're outta his life by the time he gets home. Don't even tell him to his face, just leave a note. I'll make some calls, situate you at another joint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (right in her face) Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't an act. I meant it. I love him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (close to losing it) What's there to fuckin' love? He's a loser. Always has been, always will be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were his friend...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I thought you were a smart cookie when I picked you out. You do not want to fuck me over, darlin'. I'll see to it that your next John's a rattlesnake out in the desert. Now get the fuck outta here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie approaches some cocktail waitresses about to go off duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off Bernie's expression: Oh...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi. Any of you seen Natalie around? I'm supposed to give her a ride home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 I think she left already. She wasn't feelin' too good. We been covering for her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie's Buick pulls into the lot. He parks, heads for his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie enters. Flips on the light. No Natalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer. He heads over. Finds it empty. Concern spreads across his features. He glances around the room. Notices the closet wide open. Natalie's clothes missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's when he catches sight of the note taped to the dresser mirror. He rushes over, rips it off.

dialogue.raw_text: (calls to the bathroom) Natalie? You in there?

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Natalie.
