result.ToD: I GUESS IT JUST WASN'T IN THE CARDS FOR US
result.heading: I GUESS IT JUST WASN'T IN THE CARDS FOR US

direction.raw_text: . I GUESS IT JUST WASN'T IN THE CARDS FOR US. TAKE CARE, NATALIE. Bernie slumps to the floor in disbelief. Starts to tremble. Then rocks back and forth, wracked by stifled sobs. Christ, make it stop hurting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie seated at the foot of the bed, drinking bourbon from a solitary glass. He's almost gone through an entire bottle. He glances down, notices a pair of Natalie's stockings sticking out from under the bed. He brings them up to his face. Breathes her in, only to exhale a sorry breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie stops at the bar for a cup of coffee. Doris starts to pour the cream... whoops... empty. Bernie shrugs. Par for the course. Time to go to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Bernie back in top form. Forget Mr. Cool, he's turned into Mr. Freeze with a vengeance. The high rollers are facing a nuclear winter on the floor thanks to Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man with a fresh bankroll sits at a card table full of hubris. Bernie pulls up a chair next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a crowd of players hovering over a busy craps table. The cheerful congregation turns sour as the dice are flung. Players groan as they jettison the table, leaving just Bernie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a dealer pull a six card twenty one as players sit with twelves and thirteens. They sit stunned as their money is swept away. The same man with the hefty bankroll unclips the last of his green. He throws it over to the dealer to change in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry, roaming the floor, is visibly disturbed by Bernie's cooling ability. It's something he can't quantify and it unsettles him. He glances up toward Shelly's observation window, knows the man is gloating. Good call. From behind the glass, Shelly lights up a stogey. Hint of a smile. You go, Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny Cappella rocks the house. PAN ACROSS to Shelly and Bernie seated in Shelly's booth. Shelly is in a jovial mood, while Bernie is a portrait of misery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie shrugs an apology, shifts his gaze to Johnny Cappella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly looks almost... tortured. Something he needs to get off his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off Bernie's shocked expression -- INT. BERNIE'S MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Bernie sits watching TV, a bottle of Ten High next to him on the bed. Same religious channel. This time it's a mass baptism taking place on some river bank. He's about to doze off, when he hears a light rapping on the door. He cocks his head, not sure if it's the booze talking. Bernie throws open the door -- Natalie standing there. A lonely angel framed in the doorway. Suitcase at her feet. 24 carat tears glistening in the dark. They just stare at each other for an extended beat. Then Natalie stumbles into Bernie's arms. Clingwraps herself to him. Bernie squeezes his eyes closed. Holds on for dear life. It's a different kind of pain now; one that hurts so good.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to tell me the truth, Shelly. Did you say something to Natalie? Did you muscle her -- SHELLY Jesus, Bernie, is that what you think of me? That I would fuck with your happiness? That hurts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This guy's all flash. No soul. I miss Buddy. Place isn't the same without him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buddy was tired. I gave him an easy out. It coulda been a lot worse...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) You gave him an easy out? What are you talkin' about? I thought he...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He woulda never taken the buy-out offer. Buddy woulda stuck to his guns, no matter what. And they woulda ended up hurting him. I couldn't let that happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus... you... How can you sit here and justify it? Like you were Dr. Kevorkian or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me, you dumb fuck -- I loved that sonofabitch. But his time was up. What I was supposed to do, leave him to those corporate wolves? What I did, it was the humanitarian thing. That I have no doubt about. Afterwards, I held him in my arms and I cried like a fucking baby. What? You got this look -- what's this fucking look?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: from over Bernie's shoulder. There's a bittersweet look about her. Nothing good can come of this. But that's tomorrow. A long ways off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie and Natalie lie in each other's arms. Bernie seems at ease. Natalie eyeballs the ceiling, smoke wisping up from a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie looks over at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie cuts her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie finishes her cigarette. Well, she's made her bed. Bernie starts nuzzling her. She turns away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie? You awake?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's just take off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean it. Let's just pack up and go. Tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (closes his eyes) I can't do that. I've got an obligation to Shelly. There's no -- NATALIE Fuck Shelly. He doesn't give a shit about you. Let's just climb into your car and get the hell out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do that, Natalie. They'd come after me. And because you were with me... I wouldn't want that on me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just hold me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly looking on as a high roller cleans up at craps. With Bernie standing right there next to the guy. Which only seems to make it worse, as Bernie's presence spurs the player on to an even bigger win. Bernie has that goofy "my heart is full" look about him. Which can mean only one thing in Shelly's book. The man looks about ready to split an atom. We see Larry hovering nearby with a smug grin. Off of Shelly's enraged expression...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lou's black Oldsmobile pulls into the parking lot. Shelly and the boys climb out, head for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie's sunning herself at the pool. The only other people around are a middle-aged couple and a young boy. Shelly (slipping on his leather gloves), followed by Lou and Tony, strides purposefully up to Natalie -- no hellos, nothing -- just grabs her by the hair...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drags Natalie over to Bernie's room, kicks the door open, shoves Natalie inside...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! Ouch! What are you...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly throws Natalie onto the bed. Lou closes the door and draws the blinds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly heads over to the closet, rips it open, pulls out a suitcase. He starts throwing Natalie's clothes into the case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly stops packing. He grabs Natalie up off the bed, starts smacking her around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly lifts Natalie up, throws her across the room into the dresser mirror. SMASH! She crumbles to the floor, glass showering her. Natalie grabs up a shard, rushes Shelly with it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slashes Shelly across the arm. Ouch, fuck! Before Tony and Lou can make a move, Shelly ensnares her wrist -- snaps it backwards -- AARRRRGGHHH!!! Shelly snatches up the shard, shoves her back on the bed. We see her terror reflected in the jagged glass against her cheek...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slices her cheek open. Tony and Lou look on with mutual expressions: Shelly's getting a little carried away here. Shelly staggers to his feet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly reaches into his jacket, pulls out a wad of bills. Throws them at Natalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly gestures to Tony and Lou. They exit the room, leaving Natalie sobbing into one of Bernie's pillows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You got no fucking right...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did I tell you?! What did I fuckin' tell you?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tried... I couldn't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't give a fuck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gone, sweetheart. History. Kiss paradise goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hysterical) I can't leave! I won't! I love him. Doesn't that mean anything to you, you heartless fuck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who the fuck do you think you are? You ain't nobody! I could make you disappear like this... (snaps his fingers) And nobody would ever notice you were gone. Nobody!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yells) Bernie would! I got friends! You don't fuckin' own me. You got no right --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You fuckin' cunt...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think that's bad? That's just a taste, bitch. You're still here when Bernie gets home and I'll finish the job. I'll cut you into so many fuckin' pieces, the vultures'll be trading on you for a month.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here... go get yourself some cosmetic surgery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie parks. Heads for his room. He's about to reach for his key, when he realizes the door is slightly ajar. He pushes his way into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie fumbles for the light switch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's just enough moonlight in the room for Bernie to make out Natalie curled over on the bed. As he approaches, he trips over Natalie's suitcase on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He cuts himself on a splinter of shattered glass as he staggers to his feet. Which draws his attention to the mirror. Moonlight glows off the edges. That's all there is -- edges. On the dresser: his bottle of Ten High. Empty. Confused, Bernie fumbles his way over to Natalie on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches out to touch her face... instead his hand makes contact with a lump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jerks back, flips on the nightstand lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie chokes at the sight of her. She clutches a bloody rag to her cheek. Blood on the pillow... blood on the sheets... And tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie slumps down on the edge of the bed. Sucker-punched. Trying to make sense of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie stands shakily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie doesn't answer her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) No, don't. I've got a headache.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (closing the door) Did you take something? I got some aspirin in the -- NATALIE Yeah. I already took something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ouch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Natalie, what happened? The mirror...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie, no! Shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Jesus... Natalie, who did this to you? We need to call the police...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you, Bernie. I just want you to know that. I fell in love with you. That wasn't part of the plan. I thought... easy money...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly. He paid me to get next to you. To keep you around. Whatever it took...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) Shelly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it right the first night. I was for sale. Bought and paid for. You were the easy mark, Bernie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At first you were just another John. But then I started to take a closer look. For the first time, here was someone who wasn't trying to hustle me. Wasn't pretending to be somebody he wasn't. Just a decent guy trying to get back on track. And it didn't hurt any that you put me up on a pedestal. It sure puts the gutter into perspective...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still in disbelief) Shelly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly wants me gone. He says I bring you luck. Lady luck. I stayed... to tell you to your face... and then you wouldn't want me no more... and I could just go...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta get you to the hospital. We'll talk about this later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just tell me one thing, Bernie. Tell me there's gonna be a later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Bernie's hunched over figure, waiting on Natalie. He tugs at his car keys as he wrestles with his emotions. Natalie's betrayal has finally sunken in. The man's in pain. His natural instinct is to just take off. Run. Fuck Natalie. Fuck Shelly. Fuck this whole goddamn town. Suddenly he looks up. A couple of people pass by in front of him... and then there she is. Standing a few feet away, face patched-up, arms clutching herself, not sure whether to approach him or not. The sight of her just breaks Bernie's heart. He stands slowly, legs like jelly -- and in that instant it's all so clear to him. He walks over, forgiveness in his eyes, contrition in hers. She tries to say something. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They embrace with an intensity that threatens to merge their atoms into a single being.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ssshh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie drives down a quiet Vegas street. It's spooky. Almost too quiet. All the lights are green as they cruise into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie leans over and kisses him. As she does so, she catches sight of her face in the mirror. Starts to tear up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks into Bernie's eyes. Sees the most beautiful girl in the world. Tears roll down her cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off Natalie's startled reaction...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me again, Bernie. Tell me it's all gonna be okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everything's gonna be fine. This is our time. This is you and me and we're going for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look in the mirror, you don't like what you see, don't believe it. You look in my eyes. That's the only mirror you gonna need. Look in my eyes, Natalie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you. Marry me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : "HOLY ROLLER WEDDING CHAPEL. OPEN 24 HOURS."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Bernie carries Natalie out of the chapel, their lips fused together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie and Natalie burn down the highway. The lights of the big city just a glimmer in the rearview. Up ahead, a billboard reads: THE SHANGRI-LA HOTEL AND CASINO. TAKE A GAMBLE ON PARADISE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Bernie. His expression turns grim. Natalie picks up on it. She shakes her head. Silently pleading: Bernie, no. Bernie tries to shrug it off. But the spectre of Shelly sits firmly on his shoulder. There's no escaping him. We see Bernie fighting it. Losing. SHIT! In the next instant, Bernie pulls a quick U-turn across the middle shoulder, starts back toward Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie pulls into the parking lot. Kills his lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie reaches for the door. Natalie grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie shakily opens her purse, pulls out a handful of hundreds. Pushes the money at Bernie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie stuffs the cash in his jacket. Climbs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns away. Stares out the window, tears streaming down her cheeks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to do this, Bernie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I do. I have to tell him right to his face. I will not look over my shoulder for the rest of my life -- our lives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie, your chart... that first night. I wasn't being straight with you. It's the worst chart I've ever seen. There's nothing in the cards for you. I'm scared...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you see, that was before you opened your heart to me. Everything's different now. I got lady luck on my side. Ain't nothing gonna happen to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's three thousand dollars. Take it. Maybe Shelly'll accept it as a down payment. We can send him the rest in installments... after we get settled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think -- NATALIE Take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever happens, I -- NATALIE (abrupt) I know, Bernie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto; gentle) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bernie makes for the Paradise Lounge. SPLIT SECOND FLASHBACK as he imagines Shelly laying into Natalie. Fast cuts. Reverberating sound echoes. Just the fuel Bernie needs to make his stand. By the time he arrives at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's practically foaming at the mouth with rage. He barges in to find Shelly at a table in agitated conversation with Nicky, Larry and Marty. They fall silent, realizing something is wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie throws something in Shelly's face. It's that bloody rag Natalie was holding to her cheek. It lands on the table in front of everyone. Shelly swats it away with disgust. Jumps to his feet. WHAM! Bernie slugs him one. As Shelly doubles over, Bernie gets in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly's goons quickly move in, grab Bernie. Drag him away. Shelly composes himself, turns to his guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rushes off. Nicky shoots Larry a resigned look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bernie, what's the matter? You look a little fucking spooked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lay another finger on her, I swear to God I'll kill you. You hear me? I'll fuckin' kill you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you excuse me for a moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lou shoves Bernie inside. Bernie kisses floor. Shelly strides past, leans against his desk. Bernie slowly drags himself to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly's expression: Oh yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly looks to Tony and Lou:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie gets eye-to-eye with Shelly. A first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie turns his back on Shelly, strides over to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie turns, looks at Shelly. Shelly's dead serious. They hard stare each other for a beat. Bernie doesn't say anything. At least, not out loud. His eyes do all the talking: "I guess you leave me no choice either." HOLD on Bernie's steely resolve.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a hoarse whisper) Why? Why, Shelly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you never give up a good thing, Bernie. You are a good thing. The best fuckin' cooler there ever was. And I need him back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He ain't never comin' back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a dead man talking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm through with this joint, Shelly. Natalie and me, we just got married. We're outta here. I'll get a job out there in the world. Send you half my paycheck every month. Make good on my obligations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gets in Bernie's face) You try to walk on me, Bernie, and I'll fuckin' bury you. The both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You whack me, then Bernie Lootz ain't the world's biggest loser no more. That honor's gonna fall upon you, Shelly. And maybe you had it all along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck? Me? I'm the loser?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you got? What do you got in your life besides this joint?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck more do I need?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got nothin', Shelly. This place -- your legacy -- it's a mirage. You turn your back and it don't even exist. There's no day, there's no night, it's all just one big fuckin' blur and it don't count for nothin'!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You believe this fuckin' guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel real sorry for you. Yeah, you got this fear of germs thing. But it goes deeper than that. You can't get close to no one. On an emotional level. You're the worst kind of gambler there ever was: too scared to put his chips on the table. Too scared to open his heart... to extend any real kinda friendship. Always afraid it's gonna end out in the desert. Well, sweet fuckin' dreams, pal, 'cause I'm out and if that's where it ends, that's where it ends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a real heartfelt speech, Lootz. All that Jimmy Stewart in ya face intensity. You almost sold me. (massages his throat) Man, I've got a fucking lump in my throat. (a beat) But it still don't change things. You bail on me without making good on my 150 G's and I'm gonna be forced to close the books on you. You and the broad. You leave me no choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This could be the opening of the film -- Bernie standing with his back to us, facing the gold elevator doors. Murky reflection. The floor lights ascending fast... The doors open and the soundtrack goes SILENT. SLOW PUSH IN on him as he takes in the action -- a gladiator about to enter the Coliseum. Something comes alive in his eyes. A spark of determination. This is not the expression of a loser. CLOSE-UP as his foot steps onto the casino floor -- An explosion of amplified CASINO WALLA shatters the previous silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We follow Bernie as he wanders through the casino like he's done a thousand times -- but this time with conviction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie steps up to an empty table, throws down the whole three grand onto the felt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CREW working the table stop down as they realize who it is. The table is dead. Bernie couldn't be needed. The croupier slowly gathers up the green, hands it to the boxman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boxman counts the cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others chuckle. The boxman counts out the chips; they're given to Bernie. He places them all on the passline. The stickman pushes over the dice. Bernie picks a couple. He throws....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie picks up his three thousand dollars in winnings. He lets it ride. The table quickly fills up with hungry players. Bernie throws the dice again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie is now paid six thousand dollars on his pass line bet. The other players also collect their winnings. They can feel something in the air. Bernie, forehead beaded with sweat, rubs the felt a little before he picks up the dice. He throws...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie takes double odds on his bet. The boxman isn't sure what to do. Does he stop him? Does he dare? In the b.g., people gather to watch the action. Whatever it is, it's catching. The table next to them bursts into applause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Change only...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check change three thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This a pleasure cruise, Bernie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it'll be a short one. Table's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is now, anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yo Eleven! Pay the line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Winner seven!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six easy. Easy way six!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CASINO FLOOR  MONTAGE - NIGHT A -- Close on a slot machine as it pays out. The woman grabs the payout feverishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group at the blackjack table cheers as the dealer busts out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line at the cashier cage gets longer and longer. -- CHIPS. Stacks and stacks of chips, being meticulously counted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quick shot of a roulette ball dropping into number twenty-one. The dealer slowly puts the marker atop a large stack of chips in the twenty-one square.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shot of the faces of frenzied dice players waiting for the outcome of the throw. Followed by a thunderous release as the point is made. In the center of it all. Bernie Lootz. His rail is nearly full of chips. The other players pat him on the back and shake his hand as the croupiers busily pay the line. He's a winner. And it's infectious. He's gone and "contaminated" the entire casino. The slots are ringing out of control. CHEERING. WHOOPING. MOANS of delight. This much excitement threatens to take the fucking roof off. Bernie just gazes around in amazement. If only Natalie could see him now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie takes a thousand dollars in chips, tosses it gently to the croupier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire crew stop for a moment out of respect. Bernie notices. They all nod as the boxman locks up the tip money.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) Natalie... this is you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the boys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, we're coming out. Get your YO bets, C&E, any seven...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly sits alone in his office, nursing a glass of Scotch, listening to some scratchy Chet Baker on the turntable. He looks pre-occupied. Almost melancholic. Bernie's assessment of his life having hit home. Suddenly the door is thrown open. It's Tony...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shelly, take a look at number 4.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly wanders up slowly to find Bernie at the center of the crowd. He steps behind the table into the casino pit to get a closer look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boxman looks up nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly mouths the words under his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The game resumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody quiets down to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie points to Shelly standing in the pit. The crowd watches the drama play out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boxman colors up a hundred fifty thousand in chips, lays them out on the table. He counts it and claps his hands together for the cameras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly stands motionless. Staring into Bernie's eyes. The whole crowd watches. After what seems like an eternity, Shelly nods. Then the Boxman feeds the chips in with the others. A moment later, we can nary tell they were ever gone. Larry appears next to Shelly. Nicky and Marty watching from the sidelines -- dour expressions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly suddenly jabs Larry in the throat with the tips of his fingers. Larry gasps, starts to cave. Shelly keeps him upright, escorts him to a nearby men's room. Nicky and Marty looking on in amazement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the boxman) How much is he up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Around three hundred thousand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't one of you fucking geniuses call me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We tried. You weren't picking up. Besides, it was Bernie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright. We're coming out folks, hands high...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Color me up a hundred fifty thousand. (beat) And give it to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I owe you, Shelly. There it is. We're square. (to the table) Let it be known, Bernie Lootz lives up to his obligations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One hundred fifty thousand, coming in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with you? He's one of ours and he's taking us to the fucking cleaners.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lootz's off the clock. As long as he's off the clock, he's free to play. Just like every other schmuck in this joint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It smells wrong. I'm shutting him down. He's not leaving here with a dime --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The door flies open, Larry catapults into frame. OOF! Bounces off the wall. Shelly's right behind him. He drags Larry to his feet. Slams him into the wall again -- gets right up in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blended in at a subsonic level. Some kinda mantra: pain, pain, pain. Shelly headbutts Larry. It's like the sound of a walnut cracking. Larry slumps to the floor. Shelly takes a deep breath. Control, control, control. He heads over to the sink, washes his hands -- over and over. Larry moaning in the b.g. Shelly adjusts his tie in the mirror. Control.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now you listen real good, you Harvard turd. Lootz is on the up-and-up. He leaves here tonight with whatever he comes out with. You so much as touch a hair on his head and I'll fucking wallpaper this joint with your ass. Muted tones, right? (slams him hard) What's that? I don't hear nothing. Wait a minute -- yeah, now I hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly exits the men's room, makes his way back to the craps table where Bernie is. Just in time to see Bernie lay twenty five grand on the pass line. A waitress hands a drink off to Bernie. He takes a healthy swig. Then picks up the dice. Throws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd gasps in horror as Bernie's twenty five grand is quickly raked in. He replaces it with another stack of chips. The dice are pushed over to him. He rubs the felt real gently before throwing. Then lets loose the dice. All eyes follow the dice. They hit the felt and bounce around behind a stack of chips. The stickman can't spot them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A croupier makes the call as anxious players rubberneck to get a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd groans again. It appears the streak is over. Bernie looks out over the felt. This is his moment of truth. He unloads his entire rail and puts it on the field. He yells out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd chimes in with every opinion under the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dice are slowly pushed over to Bernie. The crowd is feeling it. The entire casino is feeling it. Bernie lets out a long soulful sigh. His whole life depends on the next throw and everyone knows it. Bernie rubs the felt as usual and lines up the dice to show a six and a six. He picks them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locks eyes with Shelly -- then lets loose. The dice fly from his hand. Slowly, ever so slowly we watch them sail across the table. The entire table holds their breath in anticipation...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Crap ace deuce! Line down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twelve crap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fifty thousand dollars!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) On the field? What're you fucking nuts?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't do it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Shake it, don't break it, baby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on sixty-six!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: MOMENTS LATER - NIGHT Bernie throws open the doors, stumbles out. His limp seems more pronounced. He wears a miserable expression. At the car Bernie steps up. Opens the door, slides in behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie throws her arms around him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie just looks at her. Pale, mournful features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't answer. Just starts up the car...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank God... I thought for sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay, right? You guys worked it out. He took the three grand? Tell me it's okay, Bernie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On the surveillance monitors: the epidemic continues -- players winning at every table. The Shangri-la's been wiped out. There's no way they can cover this amount of winning action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NING ACROSS to Shelly. Defeated. The phone rings incessantly in the b.g. Shelly ignores it. Lou pokes his head into the office:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly doesn't respond. He reaches into his desk drawer for that bottle and a glass. Is about to pour himself a shot... Fuck it. Pushes the glass aside. Takes it straight from the bottle. The phone keeps ringing... On the scale model of the newly proposed Shangri-la. Hold on it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Want me to get that, Shelly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! A chair enters frame, shatters "paradise."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R: Shelly trashing the model with a vengeance. Kicking the debris around the office. Drenched in sweat, Shelly staggers over to his desk. Swats the empty gin bottle to the floor. Picks up his disinfectant spray, gives his desk one last wipedown. Immaculate. Stands, walks out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the lights of the city receding in Bernie's rearview mirror. Once outside of the city limits Bernie pulls the car over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie throws open his door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throw up. And he does. It's as if he's choking up the entire city. Everything that's bad about it. Finally, he pulls himself back into the car. Slams the door. Natalie touches his cheek, a reassuring look in her eyes. Suddenly, he's smiling. He opens his coat and a huge wad of cash tumbles out. He throws it up into the air. Natalie almost chokes with surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws her arms around him... Suddenly an EXPLOSION OF LIGHT! A flashlight. In the hand of a MOTORCYCLE COP. He raps on the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cop runs the flashlight over the bundles of cash littering the car interior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie and Natalie exchange unsettled looks. The cop lowers his hand to his gun. Bernie nods at Natalie. They climb out. He directs them off to the side. Shines his light in their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cop pulls out his revolver, trains it on them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you stopping for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I'm gonna...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bahamas, here we come, baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Step out of the car please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lowers the window) What's the problem, officer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just step out of the car, please. Both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If my driving... if I was going a little fast -- I was just over excited, officer. See, we just had a big win at the Shangri-la -- COP You didn't win nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shelly opens the door to his Cadillac. Climbs behind the wheel. His keys are already waiting in the ignition. Who's gonna steal Shelly Kaplow's car, right? Shelly doesn't start her up. He just leans back in his seat, emits a deep sigh. He glances up at the rearview mirror. Catches sight of a SILHOUETTE in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie and Natalie staring into the barrel of the cop's revolver. Natalie clutches Bernie's arm. Bernie nods. So there you have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at him in shock. He gestures them to the ground behind Bernie's car. We CUT TO a shot from the highway: just the cop standing at the tail-end of Bernie's car, Natalie and Bernie hidden from view.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Jesus, Bernie, I knew it. It was too good to be true. Who were we kidding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get down on your knees. Both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: down on their knees. Bernie places his arm around Natalie, pulls her close to him. Paralyzed with terror, she still manages a bittersweet smile. Bernie should be projecting fear, but there's nothing but his overwhelming love for Natalie in his eyes. It's a two way current. This is their last moment together; everything that needs to be said is being transmitted through a look. A look that says: no regrets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicky leans forward out of the shadows. Shelly holds his gaze in the mirror. Nicky just shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shelly nods. He knows the score... A flash of steel appears against his head. Muzzle strobe -- THUP! So long, Shelly Kaplow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The kid wants you should know, Shelly, he's just protecting our investment -- the old school way. See you around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cop looms over Bernie and Natalie. Cocks his pistol. Lowers the gun to the back of Bernie's head. They appear oblivious to it. They're already in another place. Sunning themselves in the Bahamas. The cop squeezes back the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still looking at each other. Suddenly the piercing shriek of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... followed by a reverberating, bone crunching -- WHAM! -- and a GUNSHOT. Bernie and Natalie still staring into each other's eyes, not quite sure what's just transpired. Only that they're still breathing. They look around, startled to see the tail lights of a PICK-UP TRUCK about ten yards away. The cop, their would- be assassin, rendered road kill beneath the wheels. All this in the blink of an eye. Natalie clutches Bernie's arm. Suppresses a hysterical, shock- induced giggle. Bernie just looks dumbfounded. He staggers to his feet, rushes over to the pick-up truck. The driver's head is protruding through the shattered windshield. Death-glazed eyes. Bernie feels for the man's pulse just to be sure. Shakes his head. We see a dozen Coors empties on the seat and floor of the truck. Natalie checks the cop. Likewise. Bernie comes over. They regard each other breathlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses her furiously. Then drags her over to his car. They climb in. Drive off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He was drunk. It was just freak luck... (catches himself...)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't give it a name, Bernie. It scares me. All I know is, you're still running hot and that's a good thing. But we're only winners if we keep going. No looking back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lady luck, Natalie. I'm calling it. Lady luck. And we got it as long as we're together. They can't touch us now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE'S BUICK - DAWN Bernie's Buick racing into the sunrise. Racing toward the dream. Bernie, eyes fixed on the road ahead, with the contented smile of a man who has gambled on love -- and won. His prize, resting her head against his shoulder. The money, well, that ain't half bad as well. A smoky, trumpet driven Chet Baker-like piece accentuates the triumphant mood on the soundtrack, as we SUPERIMPOSE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...a little flash-forward into the future. Larry sits with a group of CORPORATE TYPES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They raise their glasses to him. Congenial smiles, one and all. Smiles that don't transcend to their eyes. Promises, promises. We'll see... DISSOLVING BACK INTO...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen... (beat) I thank you for your vote of confidence. As the Shangri-la's new Director of Casino Operations, I'm gonna make a personal guarantee to each and every one of you. Your investment in this casino will be well looked after. The future looks bright, gentlemen. Very, very bright.
dialogue.name: dialogue
